Package game

Class GameCore

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
game.GameCore
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
Tester
public abstract class GameCore
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
Author:
David Cairns Core Game class that implements default game loop. Subclasses should implement the draw() method and override the update method.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Method Details

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Signals the game loop that it's time to quit

    • run

      public void run​(boolean full, int x, int y)
      Starts the game by first initialising the game via init() and then calling the gameLoop()
      Parameters:
      full - True to set to fullscreen mode, false otherwise
      x - Width of screen in pixels
      y - Height of screen in pixels

    • setVisible

      public void setVisible​(boolean show)
      Shows and hides the main game window
      Overrides:
      setVisible in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Parameters:
      true - to show the game window, false to hide

    • loadImage

      public java.awt.Image loadImage​(java.lang.String fileName)
      Loads an image with the given 'fileName'
      Parameters:
      fileName - The file path to the image file that should be loaded
      Returns:
      A reference to the Image object that was loaded

    • gameLoop

      public void gameLoop()
      Runs through the game loop until stop() is called. This method will call your update() method followed by your draw() method to display the updated game state. It implements double buffering for both full screen and windowed mode.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Overrides:
      getWidth in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Returns:
      The screen width in pixels

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Overrides:
      getHeight in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Returns:
      The screen height in pixels

    • getFPS

      public float getFPS()
      Returns:
      The current frames per second (FPS)

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      Handles the keyReleased event to check for the 'Escape' key being pressed. If you override this method, make sure you allow the user to stop the game.
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      Handler for the keyPressed event (empty)
      Specified by:

    • keyTyped

      public void keyTyped​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      Handler for the keyTyped event (empty)
      Specified by:
      keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

    • update

      public void update​(long elapsedTime)
      Updates the state of the game/animation based on the amount of elapsed time that has passed. You should override this in your game class to do something useful.

    • draw

      public abstract void draw​(java.awt.Graphics2D g, char[][] grid)
      Subclasses must override this method to draw output to the screen via the Graphics2D object 'g'.
      Parameters:
      g - The Graphics2D object to draw with.
